review_text: We were there in early May so it was not busy. We rented a yurt which was great because rain came through. We also had medical equipment so having electricity was really nice although they don't guarantee it's reliability. Staff was very nice. Lots of areas to walk. The spring wildflowers and migrating warblers were wonderful.
I love camping here! It's a nice spot to relax and enjoy nature

Pros: Nice overall and the bathrooms have showers.

Cons: Campsites are a bit small, you're only allowed to park one car on-site (others can park in a lot at the entrance), and bathrooms are a bit far from some sites (about a 5 minute walk from the furthest away sites).

Otter River is one of our favorite campgrounds. Clean bathrooms and showers (free hot showers). Friendly staff at the Ranger Station and the Nature Center. Lots of fun and educational afternoon programs at the Nature Center for our kids. Great fishing and sometimes swimming (the beach will be marked with a red flag if you can't swim that day). There's a gorgeous 3 mile nature trail that connects to Lake Dennison (also a great spot to visit, AMAZING BEACHES)

Overall, this campground has everything you could need to tent camp, hike, fish, swim and have a great time. 5 stars. 2 thumbs up.

We spent the past weekend in yurt 3 and loved it! Such a great price for the yurt and a beautiful state park. Every employee we interacted with was very nice. Park and facilities were clean and showers were free, hot and had great water pressure. Pond near the campground was closed to swimming due to elevated bacteria levels, but our campground pass got us into Lake Dennison for free. Lake Dennison was gorgeous. Would 100% come back!

We were in spot 75, which was right on top of spot 74. The bathroom near us was closed and the road noise was LOUD all night because you're right next to the road in this area. The beach was closed when we visited, which was a big selling point for this campground over others. I wouldn't stay again. Almost all of the spots are either near the road or right on top of each other.

Peaceful. The pond is little. There is a stream that runs through it so the top water is warm but its very cold water below that layer. The forest is nice is with walking trails. Decent bathrooms. Because its a smaller campground people are typically quiet. The only real downside is that its near a major road and during the day you can hear lots of cars but at night there's less traffic so its okay.

Easy in, easy out, well maintained.. staff is super nice and friendly.. very clean and well maintained bathrooms/showers..

a little road noise from rt 202 but nothing over the top..

a smaller state park but perfect for a quick getaway..

Often not able to swim Huge snapping turtles. But it's a really fun place for fishing and swimming there's rainbow trout brown trout brook trout. And Brown bullhead Minnows and fallfish. And Bluegill. And smallmouth and largemouth Bass.
We love this place! the walk..the woods...it's all good!! We will go back
Right next to lake Dennison, great trails
Clean, quiet and helpful staff.
One of the best features of Central MA!
Majestic and nature's best!
Greatest little town!!
Secluded and quiet. Great area to sit on the bench and enjoy the views!
Peaceful, great place to go walking, kayaking.

Excellent location for outdoor enthusiasts, camping. swimming, park ranger daily activities, hiking trails, exploration and education of the wilderness. Family friendly. affordable recreation with limitless possibilities for adventures, special events and/or gatherings. cookouts. picnics, etc...Trails for fitness enthusiasts.
A beautiful and quiet place to escape the hustle and appreciate the natural world
Great place to bring family n relax
Great for a walk or fishing
Great Place to walk
Get mud on the tires

We love Otter River! We camp here often in the summer and fall. It's convenient located (in case you forgot to pack anything, there's a cumbys and a family dollar nearby. The rangers and park staff are always very helpful, knowledgeable and friendly. The park area has lots to explore: fishing, nature trails galore, swimming, berry picking (blueberries are popping right now.) Bathrooms are always well kept, stocked and clean. Showers are hot and free. The campground itself has a family friendly atmosphere. Lots of families camp here with small children and it feels safe. Awesome campground. 10/10 and 2 thumbs up!!!

This is our family favorite. We spend a lot of time here. The bathrooms are clean and well maintained. Sites come with a BBQ grill, a fire pit and a picnic table. There are potable water spigots throughout the park. Free showers are located in the large restroom, in the handicap shower stalls (hot water).  You can fish here but will only catch Fallfish and bluegills. The fishing at neighboring Lake Dennison is better.  The beach at Otter River is often closed due to high bacteria counts. But the beach at Dennison is a short 2.5 mile hike away on the nature trails (which are loaded with blueberries and blackberries in early July). The camp sells firewood but not ice and is now card only (no cash).  Very enjoyable camping here. We will definitely be back very soon.
I had a great experience at Otter River. I loved the remote campsite and access to beautiful trails. Can't wait to go back.

Nice quiet family campground. Great prices for MA residents to be able to get away for a weekend. Bathrooms could use some updating (they've been the same for 15 years since I was a kid), but overall great campground

I booked 3 nights for myself to get away and relax and I did exactly that. Not only is this place beautiful, and scenic; the staff here is absolutely wonderful. Big shout out to Shelby for being so helpful and just amazing all around. hope she is there next time, as I will be back!

I booked a last-minute two-day camping trip to Otter River over Labor Day weekend and it was wonderful. The campground is beautiful with good amenities. The sites are nice. Ours was near the main entry road (site 38) which we quickly forgot- it was completely peaceful and next to a babbling brook. The bathroom facilities were clean and have showers. There is an outdoor dishwashing sink. For $5 you can buy firewood from the park management and the fire pits are perfect - in the ground, surrounded by metal edges, with a movable grill grate. The crown jewel from my teenage son's perspective was the beautiful new basketball court! We didn't go in the pond but it looked great for little children. Lake Dennison is 5-minute drive and gorgeous for swimming and kayaking. The only reason I'm giving 4 stars is because if the campground were operating at full capacity, it might seem a bit crowded. Can't wait for our next camping trip!
Clean, well kept state park. Clean bathrooms.

Our stay here was Tuesday to Thursday. We had Yurt #4. It was extremely clean inside and out. Quiet at the end of the road so no cars going back and forth all day. Comfortable full/twin bunk and plenty of room to move around. The bathroom/showers were clean and well stocked. They even provided a sponge and dish soap at the dish washing station! Staff was helpful and friendly. The lake beach is walking distance. The road is paved which is good for bike riding. The only possible downside is that the yurts are pretty close to each other so you can hear the other campers but everyone was respectful and kept to themselves. We are going back next year and plan to stay longer. I would recommend this site.
